This question will also resolve as **Yes** if for any other reason the 2024 Chess Champion is declared by FIDE before the 11th classical game is played (e.g. a player forteits the match or is disqualified during the match).

For the champion to be decided in the first 10 games, one player must achieve a score of 7.5 points or more within those games. Given the scoring system, this would mean that one player must win at least 7.5 points out of the first 10 games, which is highly improbable but not impossible.

In previous World Chess Championships, it has been rare for the match to be decided before all scheduled games are played, especially given the high level of competition and the strategic nature of the game. However, the new regulations aim to encourage more decisive games by offering bonuses for wins and using faster time controls.

## Conclusion
While it is theoretically possible for the 2024 World Chess Champion to be decided in the first 10 games, it is not likely given the competitive balance and the strategic depth of chess at this level. The match is more likely to go the full 14 games or even to tie-breaks.

## Safety and Conduct

## Other Rules
In various sports, rules about match postponement, player injuries, or equipment issues can also lead to a game being terminated or rescheduled. For example, in baseball, if a match is suspended and cannot be completed within 24 hours, the selections may be voided.

These factors can all contribute to a championship match ending before its scheduled conclusion.
